page.title: 12A YEAR ON A FARM NEAR HORTON
page.content: {January:}Dung spreading if ground is not too wet. {February:}Dung spreading,checking and mending of fences, maintenance of machinery.Lambing takes place. {March:}If ground is not too wet fertiliser can be put on fields. {April:}If not too wet cattle may be turned out onto the fields after being in cattlesheds all Winter. {May:}Grass cutting for silage. {June:}Haymaking {July,August,September:}Corn-harvest, straw hauling. {October:}Hedge trimming. {October,November,December:}Poultry bought to fatten for Christmas, buy calves to rear through Winter,visit Christmas fatstock shows. Cattle have to have a tuberculosis and a brucellosis test, and sheep have to be sheared and dipped every year.
